<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api18ShouldKillThisTaskEv"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api18ShouldKillThisTaskEv"></span><span id="lgraph_api::ShouldKillThisTask"></span><span class="target" id="namespacelgraph__api_1a1a65e54207e7d002a1ca5f46f3752c70"></span><span class="kt"><span class="pre">bool</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">ShouldKillThisTask</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api18ShouldKillThisTaskEv" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><p>Determine if we should kill current task. </p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>True if a KillTask command was issued for this task, either due to user request or timeout. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="cpp function">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api16GetThreadContextEv">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api16GetThreadContextEv"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api16GetThreadContextEv"></span><span id="lgraph_api::GetThreadContext"></span><span class="target" id="namespacelgraph__api_1ae4e1bd62c72e8a3a285f0689bc0a1dde"></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">ThreadContextPtr</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">GetThreadContext</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api16GetThreadContextEv" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><p>Gets thread context pointer, which can then be used in ShouldKillThisTask(ctx). Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#namespacelgraph__api_1a1a65e54207e7d002a1ca5f46f3752c70"><span class="std std-ref">ShouldKillThisTask()</span></a> is equivalent to ShouldKillThisTask(GetThreadContext()). In order to save the cost of <a class="reference internal" href="#namespacelgraph__api_1ae4e1bd62c72e8a3a285f0689bc0a1dde"><span class="std std-ref">GetThreadContext()</span></a>, you can store the context and use it in ShouldKillThisTask(ctx). </p>
<p>Example: ```c++ ThreadContextPtr ctx = <a class="reference internal" href="#namespacelgraph__api_1ae4e1bd62c72e8a3a285f0689bc0a1dde"><span class="std std-ref">GetThreadContext()</span></a>; while (HasMoreWorkToDo()) { if (ShouldKillThisTask(ctx)) { break; } DoWork(); } ```</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>The thread context. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="cpp function">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api18ShouldKillThisTaskE16ThreadContextPtr">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api18ShouldKillThisTaskE16ThreadContextPtr"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api18ShouldKillThisTaskE16ThreadContextPtr"></span><span id="lgraph_api::ShouldKillThisTask__ThreadContextPtr"></span><span class="target" id="namespacelgraph__api_1a842a962cb406dd251be8aeb492510b6c"></span><span class="kt"><span class="pre">bool</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">ShouldKillThisTask</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="n"><span class="pre">ThreadContextPtr</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n sig-param"><span class="pre">ctx</span></span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api18ShouldKillThisTaskE16ThreadContextPtr" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><p>Determine if we should kill the task currently running in the thread identified by ctx. </p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><strong>ctx</strong> – The context, as obtained with GetThreadContext.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>True if a KillTask command was issued for this task. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

</div>

<dl class="cpp class">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDBE">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api7GraphDBE"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api7GraphDBE"></span><span id="lgraph_api::GraphDB"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">class</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">GraphDB</span></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDBE" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;lgraph_db.h&gt;</em></div>
<p><a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> represents a graph instance. In TuGraph, each graph instance has its own schema and access control settings. Accessing a <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> without appropriate access rights yields WriteNotAllowed. </p>
<p>A <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> becomes invalid if <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1a7f7a3199c392465d0767c6506c1af5b4"><span class="std std-ref">Close()</span></a> is called, in which case all transactions and iterators associated with that <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> become invalid. Further operation on that <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> yields InvalidGraphDB. </p>
<div class="breathe-sectiondef docutils container">

Users should use <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1Galaxy_1a6fb2b45705dfd8a1b6b357e12a40c53d"><span class="std std-ref">Galaxy::OpenGraph()</span></a> to get <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a>. </p>

<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB5CloseEv">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api7GraphDB5CloseEv"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api7GraphDB5CloseEv"></span><span id="lgraph_api::GraphDB::Close"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1a7f7a3199c392465d0767c6506c1af5b4"></span><span class="kt"><span class="pre">void</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">Close</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB5CloseEv" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><p>Close the graph. This will close the graph and release all transactions, iterators associated with the graph. After calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1a7f7a3199c392465d0767c6506c1af5b4"><span class="std std-ref">Close()</span></a>, the graph becomes invalid, and cannot be used anymore. </p>
</dd></dl>

<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB13CreateReadTxnEv">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api7GraphDB13CreateReadTxnEv"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api7GraphDB13CreateReadTxnEv"></span><span id="lgraph_api::GraphDB::CreateReadTxn"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1af1601dcee2e9c15563e0d8e73b7bff14"></span><a class="reference internal" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api11TransactionE" title="lgraph_api::Transaction"><span class="n"><span class="pre">Transaction</span></span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">CreateReadTxn</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB13CreateReadTxnEv" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a read transaction. </p>
<dl class="field-list simple">

<dl class="cpp function">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB14CreateWriteTxnEb">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api7GraphDB14CreateWriteTxnEb"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api7GraphDB14CreateWriteTxnEb"></span><span id="lgraph_api::GraphDB::CreateWriteTxn__b"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1a69cef34bae9c6bf907389c88056cbb74"></span><a class="reference internal" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api11TransactionE" title="lgraph_api::Transaction"><span class="n"><span class="pre">Transaction</span></span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">CreateWriteTxn</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="kt"><span class="pre">bool</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n sig-param"><span class="pre">optimistic</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k"><span class="pre">false</span></span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB14CreateWriteTxnEb" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a write transaction. Write operations can only be performed in write transactions, otherwise exceptions will be thrown. A write transaction can be optimistic. Optimistic transactions can run in parallel and any conflict will be detected during commit. If a transaction conflicts with an ealier one, a TxnConflict will be thrown during commit. </p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Throws</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">InvalidGraphDB</span></span></span> – Thrown when currently <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> is invalid. </p></li>
<li><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">WriteNotAllowed</span></span></span> – Thrown when called on a <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> with read-only access level.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><strong>optimistic</strong> – (Optional) True to create an optimistic transaction.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>The new write transaction. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="cpp function">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB7ForkTxnER11Transaction">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api7GraphDB7ForkTxnER11Transaction"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api7GraphDB7ForkTxnER11Transaction"></span><span id="lgraph_api::GraphDB::ForkTxn__TransactionR"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1a126509b9c0fe94f230d4dc78bf5f4638"></span><a class="reference internal" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api11TransactionE" title="lgraph_api::Transaction"><span class="n"><span class="pre">Transaction</span></span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">ForkTxn</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><a class="reference internal" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api11TransactionE" title="lgraph_api::Transaction"><span class="n"><span class="pre">Transaction</span></span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">&amp;</span></span><span class="n sig-param"><span class="pre">txn</span></span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB7ForkTxnER11Transaction" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><p>Forks a read transaction. The resulting read transaction will share the same view as the forked one, meaning that when reads are performed on the same vertex/edge, the results will always be identical, whether they are performed in the original transaction or the forked one. Only read transactions can be forked. Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1a126509b9c0fe94f230d4dc78bf5f4638"><span class="std std-ref">ForkTxn()</span></a> on a write txn causes an InvalidFork to be thrown. </p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Throws</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">InvalidGraphDB</span></span></span> – Thrown when currently <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> is invalid. </p></li>
<li><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">InvalidFork</span></span></span> – Thrown when txn is a write transaction.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><strong>txn</strong> – <strong>[in]</strong> The read transaction to be forked.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>A new read <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1Transaction"><span class="std std-ref">Transaction</span></a> that shares the same view with txn. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="cpp function">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB5FlushEv">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api7GraphDB5FlushEv"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api7GraphDB5FlushEv"></span><span id="lgraph_api::GraphDB::Flush"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1a0e2644b2df3c228e8d71a55b60723f31"></span><span class="kt"><span class="pre">void</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">Flush</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB5FlushEv" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><p>Flushes buffered data to disk. If there have been some async transactions, there could be data that are written to this graph, but not persisted to disk yet. Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1a0e2644b2df3c228e8d71a55b60723f31"><span class="std std-ref">Flush()</span></a> will persist the data and prevent data loss in case of system crash. </p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Throws</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">InvalidGraphDB</span></span></span> – Thrown when currently <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> is invalid. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="cpp function">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB11DropAllDataEv">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api7GraphDB11DropAllDataEv"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api7GraphDB11DropAllDataEv"></span><span id="lgraph_api::GraphDB::DropAllData"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1a784e2f7141aaed6b547faaaf52e87880"></span><span class="kt"><span class="pre">void</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">DropAllData</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7GraphDB11DropAllDataEv" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>

<li><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">WriteNotAllowed</span></span></span> – Thrown when called on a <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> with read-only access level. </p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

</dd>

By default, the constain is empty, meaning that the edge is not restricted. </p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Throws</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">InvalidGraphDB</span></span></span> – Thrown when currently <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> is invalid. </p></li>
<li><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">WriteNotAllowed</span></span></span> – Thrown when called on a <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> with read-only access level. </p></li>
<li><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">InputError</span></span></span> – if invalid schema (invalid specification, re- definition of the same field, etc.).</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>label</strong> – The label name. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>fds</strong> – The field specifications. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>temporal_field</strong> – The temporal field for tid. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>edge_constraints</strong> – (Optional) The edge constraints. An empty constrain means no restriction.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>True if it succeeds, false if label already exists. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<section id="lgraph-edge-index-iterator">
<h2>lgraph_edge_index_iterator<a class="headerlink" href="#lgraph-edge-index-iterator" title="Permalink to this headline"></a></h2>

<span class="target" id="namespacelgraph__api"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">namespace</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">lgraph_api</span></span></span><br></dt>
<dd><dl class="cpp class">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api17EdgeIndexIteratorE">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api17EdgeIndexIteratorE"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api17EdgeIndexIteratorE"></span><span id="lgraph_api::EdgeIndexIterator"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1EdgeIndexIterator"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">class</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">EdgeIndexIterator</span></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api17EdgeIndexIteratorE" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;lgraph_edge_index_iterator.h&gt;</em></div>
<p><a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1EdgeIndexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">EdgeIndexIterator</span></a> can be used to access a set of edges that has the same indexed value. If the index is unique (that is, each Edge has a unique index value), then each <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1EdgeIndexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">EdgeIndexIterator</span></a> will only have one edge unique id, and will become invalid after <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1EdgeIndexIterator_1a3947d19ac087ef2cd68c2409920339c4"><span class="std std-ref">Next()</span></a> is called. </p>
<p>An <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1EdgeIndexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">EdgeIndexIterator</span></a> is valid iff it points to a valid (index_value, euid) pair, otherwise it is invalid. Calling member function on an invalid <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1EdgeIndexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">EdgeIndexIterator</span></a> throws an exception, except for the <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1EdgeIndexIterator_1ac532c4b500b1a85ea22217f2c65a70ed"><span class="std std-ref">IsValid()</span></a> function. </p>

<dl class="cpp class">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api14InEdgeIteratorE">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api14InEdgeIteratorE"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api14InEdgeIteratorE"></span><span id="lgraph_api::InEdgeIterator"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">class</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">InEdgeIterator</span></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api14InEdgeIteratorE" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;lgraph_edge_iterator.h&gt;</em></div>
<p>An <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator"><span class="std std-ref">InEdgeIterator</span></a> can be used to iterate through the in-coming edges of a vertex. Edges are sorted in (lid, tid, src, eid) order, and each (dst, lid, tid, src, eid) tuple is guaranteed to uniquely identify an edge. </p>
<p>An <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator"><span class="std std-ref">InEdgeIterator</span></a> is valid iff it points to a valid in-coming edge, otherwise it is invalid. Calling member function on an invalid <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator"><span class="std std-ref">InEdgeIterator</span></a> throws an exception, except for the <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator_1ac532c4b500b1a85ea22217f2c65a70ed"><span class="std std-ref">IsValid()</span></a> and <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator_1a13a70a437c20c75202f8920f4530286f"><span class="std std-ref">Goto()</span></a> functions.</p>
<p>The following operations invalidates an <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator"><span class="std std-ref">InEdgeIterator</span></a>:</p><ol class="lowerroman simple">
<li><p>Constructing an <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator"><span class="std std-ref">InEdgeIterator</span></a> for non-existing edge.</p></li>
<li><p>Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator_1a13a70a437c20c75202f8920f4530286f"><span class="std std-ref">Goto()</span></a> with the id of a non-existing edge.</p></li>
<li><p>Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator_1a3947d19ac087ef2cd68c2409920339c4"><span class="std std-ref">Next()</span></a> on the last in-coming edge.</p></li>
<li><p>Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator_1ac2e5aab0612d67400354a4fe71278a21"><span class="std std-ref">Delete()</span></a> on the last in-coming edge.</p></li>
<li><p>Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1InEdgeIterator_1a89634b2f140e79d6fd93030747f9e927"><span class="std std-ref">Close()</span></a> on the iterator.</p></li>
</ol>
<p></p>
<p>In TuGraph, every iterator belongs to a transaction, and can only be used when the transaction is valid. Calling member functions on an iterator inside an invalid transaction yields InvalidTxn, except for Invalid(). </p>

</ul>
</dd>

<li><p><strong>euid</strong> – Edge Unique Id. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>nearest</strong> – (Optional) True to get the nearest edge if the specified one cannot be found.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Returns</dt>

</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="cpp class">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api15OutEdgeIteratorE">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api15OutEdgeIteratorE"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api15OutEdgeIteratorE"></span><span id="lgraph_api::OutEdgeIterator"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">class</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">OutEdgeIterator</span></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api15OutEdgeIteratorE" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;lgraph_edge_iterator.h&gt;</em></div>
<p>An <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator"><span class="std std-ref">OutEdgeIterator</span></a> can be used to iterate through the out-going edges of a vertex. Edges are sorted in (lid, dst, eid) order, and each (src, lid, tid, dst, eid) tuple is guaranteed to uniquely identify an edge. </p>
<p>An <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator"><span class="std std-ref">OutEdgeIterator</span></a> is valid iff it points to a valid out-going edge, otherwise it is invalid. Calling member function on an invalid <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator"><span class="std std-ref">OutEdgeIterator</span></a> throws an InvalidIterator, except for the <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator_1a472f705194218179e9cf26ffb288da6c"><span class="std std-ref">IsValid()</span></a> and <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator_1a13a70a437c20c75202f8920f4530286f"><span class="std std-ref">Goto()</span></a> functions.</p>
<p>The following operations invalidates an <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator"><span class="std std-ref">OutEdgeIterator</span></a>:</p><ol class="lowerroman simple">
<li><p>Constructing an <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator"><span class="std std-ref">OutEdgeIterator</span></a> for non-existing edge.</p></li>
<li><p>Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator_1a13a70a437c20c75202f8920f4530286f"><span class="std std-ref">Goto()</span></a> with the id of a non-existing edge.</p></li>
<li><p>Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator_1a3947d19ac087ef2cd68c2409920339c4"><span class="std std-ref">Next()</span></a> on the last out-going edge.</p></li>
<li><p>Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator_1ac2e5aab0612d67400354a4fe71278a21"><span class="std std-ref">Delete()</span></a> on the last out-going edge.</p></li>
<li><p>Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator_1a89634b2f140e79d6fd93030747f9e927"><span class="std std-ref">Close()</span></a> on the iterator.</p></li>
</ol>
<p></p>
<p>In TuGraph, every iterator belongs to a transaction, and can only be used when the transaction is valid. Calling member functions on an iterator inside an invalid transaction yields InvalidTxn, except for Invalid(). </p>

<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api15OutEdgeIterator4GotoE7EdgeUidb"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api15OutEdgeIterator4GotoE7EdgeUidb"></span><span id="lgraph_api::OutEdgeIterator::Goto__EdgeUid.b"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1OutEdgeIterator_1a13a70a437c20c75202f8920f4530286f"></span><span class="kt"><span class="pre">bool</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">Goto</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><a class="reference internal" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api7EdgeUidE" title="lgraph_api::EdgeUid"><span class="n"><span class="pre">EdgeUid</span></span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="n sig-param"><span class="pre">euid</span></span>, <span class="kt"><span class="pre">bool</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n sig-param"><span class="pre">nearest</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k"><span class="pre">false</span></span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api15OutEdgeIterator4GotoE7EdgeUidb" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><p>Go to the edge specified by euid. That is, an edge from Vertex euid.src to euid.dst, with LabelId==euid.label, Tid==euid.tid, and EdgeId==euid.eid. If neareast==true and the exact edge was not found, the iterator tries to get the next edge that sorts after the specified edge. The edges are sorted in (label, tid, dst, eid) order. The iterator becomes invalid if there is no outgoing edge from euid.src that sorts after euid. </p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Throws</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">InvalidTxn</span></span></span> – Thrown when called inside an invalid transaction.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>euid</strong> – Edge Unique ID. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>nearest</strong> – (Optional) True to get the nearest edge if the specified one cannot be found.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>True if it succeeds, false if there is no such edge. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<section id="lgraph-galaxy">
<h2>lgraph_galaxy<a class="headerlink" href="#lgraph-galaxy" title="Permalink to this headline"></a></h2>
<dl class="cpp type">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp">
<span class="target" id="namespacelgraph"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">namespace</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">lgraph</span></span></span><br></dt>

<dl class="cpp type">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp">
<span class="target" id="namespacelgraph__api"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">namespace</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">lgraph_api</span></span></span><br></dt>
<dd><dl class="cpp class">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api6GalaxyE">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api6GalaxyE"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api6GalaxyE"></span><span id="lgraph_api::Galaxy"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1Galaxy"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">class</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">Galaxy</span></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api6GalaxyE" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;lgraph_galaxy.h&gt;</em></div>
<p>A galaxy is the storage engine for one TuGraph instance. It manages a set of User/Role/GraphDBs. </p>
<p>A galaxy can be opened in async mode, in which case <em>ALL</em> write transactions will be treated as async, whether they declare async or not. This can come in handy if we are performing a lot of writing, but can cause data loss for online processing. </p>
<div class="breathe-sectiondef docutils container">

<dd><p>Constructor. </p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Throws</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">DBNotExist</span></span></span> – Thrown if DB does not exist and create_if_not_exist is false. </p></li>
<li><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">IOError</span></span></span> – Thrown if DB does not exist, but we failed to create the DB due to IO error. </p></li>
<li><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">InputError</span></span></span> – Thrown if there are other input errors. e.g., dir is actually a plain file, or DB is corruptted.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>dir</strong> – The TuGraph dir. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>durable</strong> – (Optional) True to open in durable mode. If set to false, ALL write transactions are async, whether they declare async or not. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>create_if_not_exist</strong> – (Optional) If true, the TuGraph DB will be created if dir does not exist; otherwise, an exception is thrown. </p></li>
</ul>
</dd>

<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;lgraph_result.h&gt;</em></div>
<p><a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1Result"><span class="std std-ref">Result</span></a> table, result instance provide [MutableRecord], [ResetHeader], [Dump] and [Load] method. Table also provide some method to view content of table. For example, [Header] and [Recordview]. </p>
<p>It’s worth noting that you are best to define your header before using result table. eg. auto result = <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1Result"><span class="std std-ref">Result</span></a>({title, LGraphType}…) If you do not define header and initialize by <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1Result_1a6f00c89a8bbfd566f848740f9e563604"><span class="std std-ref">Result()</span></a>, you will get a empty table without header, you just use the table after using [ResetHeader] method to set your header. </p>

<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api9traversal17FrontierTraversalE"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api9traversal17FrontierTraversalE"></span><span id="lgraph_api::traversal::FrontierTraversal"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1traversal_1_1FrontierTraversal"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">class</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">FrontierTraversal</span></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api9traversal17FrontierTraversalE" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;lgraph_traversal.h&gt;</em></div>
<p><a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1traversal_1_1FrontierTraversal"><span class="std std-ref">FrontierTraversal</span></a> provides the most common way to traverse graphs. You can start from a single vertex or a set of vertices (known as the initial frontier), and expand them frontier by frontier, each time visiting neighboring vertices of the current frontier and make those matching specified conditions the new frontier. One powerful feature of <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1traversal_1_1FrontierTraversal"><span class="std std-ref">FrontierTraversal</span></a> is that the traversal can be performed in parallel, accelerating those <em>deep</em> queries significantly. </p>

<dd><p>Construct the <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1traversal_1_1FrontierTraversal"><span class="std std-ref">FrontierTraversal</span></a> object. Note that the transaction must be read- only if you want to perform the traversals in parallel (i.e. TRAVERSAL_PARALLEL is specified in flags). Be careful when TRAVERSAL_ALLOW_REVISITS is used, as each vertex may be visited more than once, making the result set huge. </p>

<li><p><strong>txn</strong> – <strong>[inout]</strong> The transaction. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>flags</strong> – (Optional) The options used during traversals. </p></li>
</ul>
</dd>

<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;lgraph_traversal.h&gt;</em></div>
<p><a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1traversal_1_1PathTraversal"><span class="std std-ref">PathTraversal</span></a> behaves similar to <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1traversal_1_1FrontierTraversal"><span class="std std-ref">FrontierTraversal</span></a>, except that 1) Each vertex could be revisited multiple times. 2) Each traversed path would be stored, and the filter function has access to the path. </p>

<dd><p>Construct the <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1traversal_1_1PathTraversal"><span class="std std-ref">PathTraversal</span></a> object. Note that the transaction must be read-only if you want to perform the traversals in parallel (i.e. TRAVERSAL_PARALLEL is specified in flags). Since TRAVERSAL_ALLOW_REVISITS is implied in <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1traversal_1_1PathTraversal"><span class="std std-ref">PathTraversal</span></a> and storing the Paths also takes a lot of space, the memory consumption could be very large if the filters are not very selective. </p>
<dl class="field-list simple">

<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">

<li><p><strong>txn</strong> – <strong>[inout]</strong> The transaction. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>flags</strong> – The options used during traversals. </p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<section id="lgraph-txn">
<h2>lgraph_txn<a class="headerlink" href="#lgraph-txn" title="Permalink to this headline"></a></h2>
<dl class="cpp type">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp">
<span class="target" id="namespacelgraph"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">namespace</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">lgraph</span></span></span><br></dt>
<dd></dd></dl>

<dl class="cpp type">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp">
<span class="target" id="namespacelgraph__api"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">namespace</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">lgraph_api</span></span></span><br></dt>
<dd><dl class="cpp class">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api11TransactionE">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api11TransactionE"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api11TransactionE"></span><span id="lgraph_api::Transaction"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1Transaction"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">class</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">Transaction</span></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api11TransactionE" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;lgraph_txn.h&gt;</em></div>
<p>TuGraph operations happen in transactions. A transaction is sequence of operations that is carried out atomically on the <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a>. TuGraph transactions provides full ACID guarantees. </p>
<p>Transactions are created using <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1af1601dcee2e9c15563e0d8e73b7bff14"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB::CreateReadTxn()</span></a> and <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB_1a69cef34bae9c6bf907389c88056cbb74"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB::CreateWriteTxn()</span></a>. A read transaction can only perform read operations, otherwise an exception is thrown. A write transaction can perform reads as well as writes. There are performance differences between read and write operations. So if you only need read in a transaction, you should create a read transaction.</p>
<p>Each transaction must be used in one thread only, and they should not be passed from one thread to another unless it is a forked transaction.</p>
<p>Read transactions can be forked. The new copy of the transaction will have the same view as the forked one, and it can be used in a separate thread. By forking from one read transaction and using the forked copies in different threads, we can parallelize the execution of specific operations. For example, you can implement a parallel BFS with this capability. Also, you can dump a snapshot of the whole graph using </p>

<dd><p>Query if index is ready for use. This should be used only to decide whether to use an index. To wait for an index to be ready, use lgraphDB::WaitIndexReady(). </p>
<p>VertexIndex building is async, especially when added for a (label, field) that already has a lot of vertices. This function tells us if the index building is finished.</p>
<p>DO NOT wait for index building in a transaction. Write transactions block other write transactions, so blocking in a write transaction is always a bad idea. And long-living read transactions interfere with GC, making the DB grow unexpectly.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>label</strong> – The label. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>field</strong> – The field.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>True if index ready, false if not. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api11Transaction13IsEdgeIndexedERKNSt6stringERKNSt6stringE"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api11Transaction13IsEdgeIndexedERKNSt6stringERKNSt6stringE"></span><span id="lgraph_api::Transaction::IsEdgeIndexed__ssCR.ssCR"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1Transaction_1a756786aa9a73934882b57cea8d808cf6"></span><span class="kt"><span class="pre">bool</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">IsEdgeIndexed</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="k"><span class="pre">const</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><span class="pre">std</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">::</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">string</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">&amp;</span></span><span class="n sig-param"><span class="pre">label</span></span>, <span class="k"><span class="pre">const</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><span class="pre">std</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">::</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">string</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">&amp;</span></span><span class="n sig-param"><span class="pre">field</span></span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api11Transaction13IsEdgeIndexedERKNSt6stringERKNSt6stringE" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><p>Query if index is ready for use. This should be used only to decide whether to use an index. To wait for an index to be ready, use lgraphDB::WaitIndexReady(). </p>
<p>VertexIndex building is async, especially when added for a (label, field) that already has a lot of edges. This function tells us if the index building is finished.</p>
<p>DO NOT wait for index building in a transaction. Write transactions block other write transactions, so blocking in a write transaction is always a bad idea. And long-living read transactions interfere with GC, making the DB grow unexpectly.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>label</strong> – The label. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>field</strong> – The field.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>True if index ready, false if not. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<section id="lgraph-vertex-index-iterator">

<dd><dl class="cpp class">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api19VertexIndexIteratorE">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api19VertexIndexIteratorE"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api19VertexIndexIteratorE"></span><span id="lgraph_api::VertexIndexIterator"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIndexIterator"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">class</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">VertexIndexIterator</span></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api19VertexIndexIteratorE" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;lgraph_vertex_index_iterator.h&gt;</em></div>
<p><a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIndexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">VertexIndexIterator</span></a> can be used to access a set of vertices that has the same indexed value. If the index is unique (that is, each vertex has a unique index value), then each <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIndexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">VertexIndexIterator</span></a> will only have one VertexId, and will become invalid after <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIndexIterator_1a3947d19ac087ef2cd68c2409920339c4"><span class="std std-ref">Next()</span></a> is called. </p>
<p>An <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIndexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">VertexIndexIterator</span></a> is valid iff it points to a valid (index_value, vid) pair, otherwise it is invalid. Calling member function on an invalid <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIndexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">VertexIndexIterator</span></a> throws an exception, except for the <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIndexIterator_1ac532c4b500b1a85ea22217f2c65a70ed"><span class="std std-ref">IsValid()</span></a> function. </p>

<dl class="cpp function">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api19VertexIndexIterator4NextEv">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api19VertexIndexIterator4NextEv"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api19VertexIndexIterator4NextEv"></span><span id="lgraph_api::VertexIndexIterator::Next"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIndexIterator_1a3947d19ac087ef2cd68c2409920339c4"></span><span class="kt"><span class="pre">bool</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">Next</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api19VertexIndexIterator4NextEv" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>

</dd>

</dd></dl>

<dd><p>Gets the current index value. The vids are sorted in (IndexValue, Vid) order. When <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIndexIterator_1a3947d19ac087ef2cd68c2409920339c4"><span class="std std-ref">Next()</span></a> is called, the iterator moves from one vid to next, possibly moving from one IndexValue to another. This function tells the IndexValue currently pointed to. </p>

<dd class="field-odd"><p>The key. </p>

<section id="lgraph-vertex-iterator">
<h2>lgraph_vertex_iterator<a class="headerlink" href="#lgraph-vertex-iterator" title="Permalink to this headline"></a></h2>
<dl class="cpp type">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp">

<dl class="cpp type">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp">
<span class="target" id="namespacelgraph__api"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">namespace</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">lgraph_api</span></span></span><br></dt>
<dd><dl class="cpp class">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api14VertexIteratorE">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api14VertexIteratorE"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api14VertexIteratorE"></span><span id="lgraph_api::VertexIterator"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator"></span><span class="k"><span class="pre">class</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">VertexIterator</span></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api14VertexIteratorE" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;lgraph_vertex_iterator.h&gt;</em></div>
<p><a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">VertexIterator</span></a> can be used to iterate through vertices in the DB. Vertices are sorted according to vertex id in the DB. </p>
<p>A <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">VertexIterator</span></a> is valid iff it points to a valid vertex. Calling method functions on an invalid <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">VertexIterator</span></a> throws an InvalidIterator, except for the <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator_1ac532c4b500b1a85ea22217f2c65a70ed"><span class="std std-ref">IsValid()</span></a> and <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator_1a819e93dbf674b25c461534b19241cb91"><span class="std std-ref">Goto()</span></a> functions.</p>
<p>The following operations invalidates a <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">VertexIterator</span></a>:</p><ol class="lowerroman simple">
<li><p>Constructing an <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator"><span class="std std-ref">VertexIterator</span></a> for non-existing vertex.</p></li>
<li><p>Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator_1a819e93dbf674b25c461534b19241cb91"><span class="std std-ref">Goto()</span></a> with the id of a non-existing vertex.</p></li>
<li><p>Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator_1a3947d19ac087ef2cd68c2409920339c4"><span class="std std-ref">Next()</span></a> on the last vertex.</p></li>
<li><p>Calling <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator_1ad257f9e02e38c86faaf00dd065361f5c"><span class="std std-ref">Delete()</span></a> on the last vertex. </p></li>
</ol>
<p></p>

<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Throws</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">

<dl class="cpp function">
<dt class="sig sig-object cpp" id="_CPPv4N10lgraph_api14VertexIterator4GotoE7int64_tb">
<span id="_CPPv3N10lgraph_api14VertexIterator4GotoE7int64_tb"></span><span id="_CPPv2N10lgraph_api14VertexIterator4GotoE7int64_tb"></span><span id="lgraph_api::VertexIterator::Goto__int64_t.b"></span><span class="target" id="classlgraph__api_1_1VertexIterator_1a819e93dbf674b25c461534b19241cb91"></span><span class="kt"><span class="pre">bool</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="n"><span class="pre">Goto</span></span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="n"><span class="pre">int64_t</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n sig-param"><span class="pre">vid</span></span>, <span class="kt"><span class="pre">bool</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n sig-param"><span class="pre">nearest</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k"><span class="pre">false</span></span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#_CPPv4N10lgraph_api14VertexIterator4GotoE7int64_tb" title="Permalink to this definition"></a><br></dt>

<li><p><strong>vid</strong> – Vertex id of the vertex to go. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>nearest</strong> – (Optional) True to go to the closest vertex with id&gt;=vid.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>True if it succeeds, otherwise false (no such vertex). </p>
</dd>
</dl>

<p>AdjList&lt;EdgeData&gt; allows range-based for-loop over AdjUnit&lt;EdgeData&gt;. </p>
<p>Graph.</p>
<p>
EdgeData is used for representing edge weights (the default type is <a class="reference internal" href="#structlgraph__api_1_1olap_1_1Empty"><span class="std std-ref">Empty</span></a> which is used for unweighted graphs).</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Template Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>EdgeData</strong> – Type of the edge data.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>EdgeData</strong> – Graph instances represent static (sub)graphs loaded from txt file. The internal organization uses compressed sparse matrix formats which are optimized for read-only accesses.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>EdgeData</strong> – Type of the edge data. </p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p>Subclassed by <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1olap_1_1OlapOnDB"><span class="std std-ref">OlapOnDB&lt; EdgeData &gt;</span></a></p>

<dd><div class="docutils container">
<em>#include &lt;olap_on_db.h&gt;</em></div>
<p>Snapshot is a derived class of Graph. Snapshot instances represent static (sub)graphs exported from LightningGraph. The internal organization uses compressed sparse matrix formats which are optimized for read-only accesses. </p>
<p>EdgeData is used for representing edge weights (the default type is <a class="reference internal" href="#structlgraph__api_1_1olap_1_1Empty"><span class="std std-ref">Empty</span></a> which is used for unweighted graphs).</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Template Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><strong>EdgeData</strong> – Type of the edge data. </p>
</dd>
</dl>

definition"></a><br></dt>
<dd><p>Generate a graph with LightningGraph. For V1 Procedures. </p>
<p>
Note: read-write transactions are not recommended here for safety, e.g. some vertices might be removed causing inconsistencies of the analysis, and vertex data extraction may not work for deleted vertices). The constructed graph should contain all vertices whose vertex_filter calls return true and all edges <em>sourced from</em> these vertices whose out_edge_filter calls return true. If SNAPSHOT_UNDIRECTED is specified, the graph will be made symmetric (i.e. reversed edges are also added to the graph). </p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Throws</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><span><span class="cpp-expr sig sig-inline cpp"><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">::</span><span class="n">runtime_error</span></span></span> – Raised when a runtime error condition occurs.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>db</strong> – <strong>[inout]</strong> The <a class="reference internal" href="#classlgraph__api_1_1GraphDB"><span class="std std-ref">GraphDB</span></a> instance. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>txn</strong> – <strong>[inout]</strong> The transaction. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>flags</strong> – (Optional) The generation flags. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>vertex_filter</strong> – <strong>[inout]</strong> (Optional) A function filtering vertices. </p></li>
<li><p><strong>out_edge_filter</strong> – <strong>[inout]</strong> (Optional) A function filtering out edges.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>
